definitions.definition: A male parent , especially of a human; a male who parents a child (which he has sired , adopted , fostered , taken as his own, etc.).
examples: My father was a strong influence on me.

definitions.definition: A male who has sired a baby ; this person in relation to his child or children .
examples: My friend Tony just became a father .

definitions.definition: A male ancestor more remote than a parent; a progenitor; especially, a first ancestor.
A term of respectful address for an elderly man.
examples: Come, father ; you can sit here.

definitions.definition: A term of respectful address for a priest.
A person who plays the role of a father in some way.
examples: My brother was a father to me after my parents got divorced.
The child is father to the man.

definitions.definition: A pioneering figure in a particular field.
examples: Albert Einstein is the father of modern physics.

definitions.definition: Something that is the greatest or most significant of its kind.
A member of a church council .
The archived older version of a file that immediately precedes the current version, and was itself derived from the grandfather .
